website_summaries.verdict: Customers looking for a rucksack-inspired pack should check out this atypical laptop bag.
pros: Offers easy access to larger compartment with rucksack-style design
Has padded laptop space for secure protection
One exterior pocket for housing small valuables
cons: A few buyers noticed the bag had lower durability than other Timbuk2 packs

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Purchase
customer_reviews.text: On my 3rd day using the backpack I packed some clothes along with my macbook air, got in the car for a 3 hours road trip with the backpack on my lap and when I was unpacking noticed the inside bag that holds the laptop just badly ripped. Tried to contact the company and guess what? A robot answered the email asking me to pay $20 bucks just to get started with a warranty determination process.
customer_reviews.author: Amed Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack, bad weather protection.
customer_reviews.text: I love the backpack but despite the outer layer seeming weather resistant water soaks right into it. Really disappointed with the sealing. The canvas on Jansport backpacks is much better. Wish it had two mesh pockets on the outside. The large pocket is a good size and I like the padded laptop sleeve. The straps are very comfy for heavy loads.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie M Contour

customer_reviews.title: Great product but doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: Used it for around 2 years and started to see the tarpaulin at the top is degrading by itself despite light duty use carrying laptop to work. When contacted Timbuk2 customer service, they said its a normal wear and tear and not repairable.
customer_reviews.author: ssyap

customer_reviews.title: great for commuting
customer_reviews.text: i've been taking this backpack with me when i go grocery shopping, to the beach, to a picnic in the park, pretty much anywhere i go on my bike where i need to carry things. it can fit a lot, and of course with the adjustable velcro and buckles, you can make the bag bigger or smaller to suit your needs. it's great for biking around the city with. the exterior fabric will get wet when it rains, but it kept everything inside dry. i enjoy all the organizational inside pockets and the protected laptop sleeve compartment, and will likely use this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous218

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack Super durable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a backpack with a place for my iPad and one large compartment. This is the one. Also it is almost waterproof. The flap on top keeps out the rain and snow. I use it for everything, work, travel and fun. Very durable. I used it every day for three years. Bought this 2nd one because I thought they might discontinue this model.
customer_reviews.author: amc

customer_reviews.title: Good riding bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Been riding with a chrome mini citizen which is a 20l bag, but due to lack of external bike lock storage, ran out of room quickly. This bag solved that problem well, and cheaply. Things I wish the bag did better, Gussetting deeper and better constructed, or roll top for better water resistance Laptop access from side External pocket slightly bigger, with built in organization, and a key tether
customer_reviews.author: rivethead147

customer_reviews.title: Yes waterproof for real
customer_reviews.text: Gonna keep it simple because this is what I cared about when ordering this backpack—yes, it is waterPROOF. I ordered a million backpacks searching for a waterproof bag and this is it. It is durable and the perfect size for traveling. I carried this bag through Japan in the rain and it kept everything dry. I’ve had it for a couple years and it holds up. I love this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: brie

customer_reviews.title: PICTURE PERFECT CYCLE/HIKE/WORK PACK!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack! I put my tripod, camera, computer pad and so much more in this beautiful day pack! I use it everyday to cycle to wherever I need to go. Work/Study/Hike/Cycle! Even out to the hiking trails in the Northwest. Some people didn't like the strap design fit but it works for me. Plus if you get some lanyard clips you can attach another water bottle or some other piece of equipment. Timbuk2 has made a leap with an affordable day pack comparable to a Chrome pack. Blessings Everyone! Stay Hydrated with Structured Water!
customer_reviews.author: TRAVIS CARPER

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack (as well as two of my friends) for a research trip to Costa Rica this summer and I don't regret the purchase at all! It is light weight, but has enough storage for whatever you need. Its water proof and comfy! I was constantly in the field and it was super helpful. If you're looking for a wonderful quality bag, this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All-time favorite backpack
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this backpack to use when I ride my bike to work, however I haven't been able to use it for commuting yet (muscle injury/ weather). However, I used it on two recent trips, London & NYC. I used the Rogue backpack for my laptop and a couple days worth of clothing. After a whole day of sightseeing in London, the bag still felt comfy and didn't rub or chafe. I haven't been able to test its water resistance yet, but its overall durability has been fantastic. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The best camera bag for the price. The pocket that holds the tripod could be made of better fabric instead of nettings. We'll see how long it will hold. Also, the side pocket for quick access to the camera can be better paded since the screen is facing outward and of something hits it's hard there's a good chance that the camera screen will break. I added a paded material on the on the inside which helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: Khai Pham

customer_reviews.title: Love at first sight
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this pack! Fits great, instantly can feel and see the high quality materials and zips. I need to give it some more vigorous testing, but feels waterproof and sturdy. Fits my body great and looks awesome. Very happy with this purchase, I tried/returned a few similar ones before landing on this one and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack. Ive owned 2
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Rogue from Timbuk2 that i have owned. its the perfect pack for my everyday life in the City. it holds my laptop, tablet, external batteries, cords, hoodie, gloves, and some snacks. I got some add-ons for the moll webbing on the outside that hold a bicycle air pump, umbrella, and my keys. its bigger than a daypack but not too big that i look like a traveler. i would deffinitely tell a friend to get one and i will probably buy a third for myself in time.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Velcro on the outside is a nice touch...at least for me, one of the main reasons I bought it. I’ve read the other reviews about the material and how it peels off after awhile. It’s true. But it definitely is nice quality. I had a north face with the same material, it does end up peeling. It’s been awhile since my last timbuk2 which was a messenger bag.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am a graduate student who carries a backpack nearly every day and LOVE this. I was worried that it would be a little heavy, but it is so well constructed that carrying my 15in laptop in a hard case, laptop charger, a notebook, a hardback book or two, my wallet, and water bottle feels super easy. It fits my slight frame quite well. This was a major upgrade from the Patagonia Black Hole backpack I had been using for several years.
customer_reviews.author: S Esp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Laptop Messenger that has been to hell and back and still has a million miles left in it. Unfortunately due to back issues I needed to abandon the shoulder bag and get a backpack. At first I thought this was going to be too small. I'm glad I stuck with it. Its the perfect size for an every day bag with out being so big that you end up carry way more crap than you need to! I regularly carry my laptop, mouse, wallet, lunch, snacks, water bottle, sweatshirt.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for his biking commute, it seems tougher than others he has gotten. Purchased in early 2016, so it hasn't been that long since we got it. I will update if there end up being any wear issues over time. The colors/textures turned out to be better than expected. It did take some convincing of my husband that it was waterproof enough for his laptop, because the plu fabric used has the coating on the reverse side of the fabric and the inside is lined, which means you cannot actually see the rubbery/plastic coating that makes it waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey M. Short

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized bag for every day.
customer_reviews.text: Really great bag, perfect size for my laptop (15 in MacBook Air) and room for my other stuff, but not too big. If there’s a draw back, it might be nice to have two separate compartments in the interior, but this is just one large area, aside from the laptop pouch and a couple accessory pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Verdell

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack everyday, multiple times a day as I commute by foot/Train in Boston. It's been great - especially the fact that it's waterproof. I've been caught in heavy rainfall multiple times and the inside of my bag has stayed dry. I also love this bag for travel - brought it to Wales during horrid rain and snow and it held up well. My only concern is that the waterproof coating along the handle at the top of the back is starting to separate from the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT THE SELLER PROMISE NOT WHAT I NEDD ☹️☹️
customer_reviews.text: MY VERY FIRST RIDE IN RAIN ALL MY STUFF GET SO WET FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE BAG I'M LUCKY I DECIDE TO LET MY LAPTOP IN HOME UNTIL TEST IN RAIN THOS PRODUCT VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH TIMBUK2
customer_reviews.author: marlozada

customer_reviews.title: and let me tell ya what a great decision that was
customer_reviews.text: I ditched my chrome messenger bag for this backpack, and let me tell ya what a great decision that was. This bag is perfect for everyday carry.. The best man purse there is. Had my laptop, phone, notebook, and a few other things in this bag went I went on a rainy bike ride the other day, and everything stayed perfectly dry. I highly recommend this bag. Buy it! Get it now, you won't regret it for a second.
customer_reviews.author: EliasK

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 products are always great, and this is on par. The side bottle pocket is great, fits my 32oz Hydroflask. It handles light rain well, although I haven’t taken it out in heavy rain for extended periods though. I switch between this and my Timbuk2 messenger for my work bag. It does have a more limited entry to the main compartment when compared to a messenger.
customer_reviews.author: Snackary

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful work bag
customer_reviews.text: I have to walk a fair distance to work from my parking place, and this bag is great for that. Roomy, well constructed, and water resistant enough to keep my electronics safe even in a rainstorm. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack every day primarily to transport my work laptop to and from my office. It is extremely durable and we'll made. I haven't had one issue with it this far. There aren't many individual smaller pockets which I thought would be a problem as I like to keep everything organized. However, after some time I've grown to like the lake of smaller pockets as it has forced me to find alternative, better ways to keep my EDC items organized. I would highly recommend this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flanary

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bag holds a lot and is slightly expandable. I use it for my bike commutes and to stop and pick up groceries. Bag works perfect for that. Only complaint I have is that it only has one water bottle pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Natto

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack and use it for work every day
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack and use it for work every day. Wish that the front pocket had more room in it. It's too tight and difficult to get your hand it there to get what you need. Also because it's too tight you can't get much in there. Also the two front buckles keep getting in the way every time you have to close the zipper on the front pocket. Their natural tendency is to fall into the front pocket when you have it open, then you have to pull them out when you want to close the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: DEF

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack around
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for the whole semester and does me perfectly well. I love the fact that when it rains, there is not a drop or hint of mist inside. This is a priority for a college student who carries a large laptop inside their bag. Does the job well and looks amazing at the same time. Would buy twice if i could haha
customer_reviews.author: Raju T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Daypack.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this bag so far. Very well thought out with nooks for organization and a nice large cavity for big stuff. Plenty of MOLLE for clipping on extra danglies and it is very comfortable overall. I bought this to replace my Timbuk2 messenger that I've used daily for nearly a decade with little wear. If this one continues the trend, I'll look at their luggage and other products first and Timbuk2 will have a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: John Marshel

customer_reviews.title: I also feel like the velcro and straps are a bit redundant in ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had another mesh pocket on the other side. When I put a bottle on the pocket, the weight is shifted a little strangely. I also feel like the velcro and straps are a bit redundant in design, the belts are just there for style because even if you don't use them, there's a big strap of velcro underneath the opening of the backpack that secures it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag every day on my bike ride to and from work. Feels nice. Looks nice. I expect it will last for some time. Keep in mind, it's not massive. This could be a plus or minus for you. It fits the things I like to carry. Doesn't always fit the things I need to carry (packages, boxes, groceries).
customer_reviews.author: Craig A

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a while and really like it. The materials and construction are very good, and it is comfortable to wear. It does not have lot of pockets in it, but it is sufficient. The Velcro closure feature works well, straps also keep it secure.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great vertical bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the money. Fits 15" macbook perfectly but depth/orientation of bag is not so great for carrying papers/books as they will tend to get mangled if floating free. Accessory pockets are standard and unremarkable but get the job done. Comfortable, looks good, and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: ahenderson

customer_reviews.title: I love this backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally in love with this backpack! This is the perfect size for my minimalist travels. So far I have taken this pack with me around California and I plan to take it with me to Europe. The pack is very rugged and keeps rain out fairly well. I really like the style and I have gotten a few compliments on it. The only issue I have with it is that the laptop sleeve seems a little flimsy for my tastes. I have solved that problem by buying a padded laptop sleeve to give my computer a little more protection. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This is the beat backpack I have ever owned. Holds everything that I need with extra room for more. I travel a lot and I use this bad to hold everything as my carry on and it takes a beating. Straps are still good, zippers are intact and it still feels like new.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus A Ledesma

customer_reviews.title: ... many things about this bag could have been made better in particular the velcro for the pocket where the ...
customer_reviews.text: So many things about this bag could have been made better in particular the velcro for the pocket where the laptop fits hooks into the threads of the nylon pockets in front of it.. this will not be good over the long-term. It started to fray within days. Additionally it could use a few more features for the price
customer_reviews.author: baddd_dogggie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome use this every single day it fights a large ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome use this every single day it fights a large amount. Fit my laptop, my lunch and even a pair of shoes while I ride my bike with this. I ride my bike with this everyday and it's awesome. Only thing I don't like and nothing to knock on the brand is it looks like a backpack so it's not the most "executive" or professional look however that's just the style it is. I still use it in that setting but don't care. It's awesome get it
customer_reviews.author: DevinK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Got a lot of compliments on bag. Sturdy. Inside is minimal but a lot of space. I would only get this if it's on sale below $50 though, would not buy for anything over. Overall, I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MightyFancyPants

customer_reviews.title: Great for commuting, plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great for my needs. I’ve bought several BS bags all have broken at the seems. I ride a motorcycle to work everyday so the bag goes through a lot. This Backpack is sturdy and hefty. The stitching is strong and the material is great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard urias

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in this bag, considering the Timbuk2 reputation. Granted, it's a pretty good deal, but it's just not great quality. The straps felt flimsy, there was not much in the way of ornganization, and the material seemed like it wouldn't hold up very long. After some more research, I returned it and got an Osprey Pixel and have been thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: TheAngryGinger

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works effectively
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, works effectively, and doesn't cost as much as comparable bags. That's all I want out of a bag, and this one fulfills my desires. My only complaint is that it could easily have another mesh bottle holder on the other side, because right now I have to choose between an umbrella and my water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This is everything I want in a backpack but I am 5'3" and a women and this has really thick heavy straps which dug into my neck and shoulders. I had to return it because I couldn't wear it. It was very disappointing. Other than that, amazing backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Briauna Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Backpack for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect backpack for what I need - something professional, can hold all of my gear for work and a coffee mug. I've had TimBuk2 products before, but this is my first backpack. The quality is in line with their brand. I am 6' 1" / 185# and the backpack is just slightly on the small side, which is precisely what I wanted. It holds my 15" MacBook with plenty of room to spare. I would not go hiking with this backpack as the ventilation is not very good when the computer is in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for commuting
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Rogue backpack--I purchased it for my daily bike commute. It is thinner than I expected, which I am very pleased with. Overall it is minimal, utilitarian, and very modern looking. The only criticism I could think to include is that the secured straps on the front of the bag are not mounted in the center, so heavier items will cause pulling/drooping in the center. I had originally planned on securing my Ulock to this strap, but the two vertical straps under the clips on the front work perfectly for this function. Overall very comfortable, looks awesome, and the pricepoint is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua David Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Cimmuter backpack AND briefcase
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag to double as my commuter cycling backpack and "briefcase" for my computer when I need it. As a commuter backpack, it is very comfortable, has plenty of room for my stuff, plus peace of mind in the event of rain on the way home. As a "briefcase," the all-black design makes it suitable for toting my laptop to a meeting or conference. The quality of hardware should last me many years. Gotta love the bottle opener, too. Nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah S.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for a low utility backpack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is ~2x as expensive as competitors, but doesn't really deserve the price it is sold for. It looks nicely aesthetically but beyond that is just an oversized backpack with a cool color scheme. There are not enough pockets to place items in. Instead you just have one exterior pocket, one in the interior and a laptop sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Colin M.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much guarantees a promotion Seriously great bag that holds ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much guarantees a promotion Seriously great bag that holds all your daily gear without being bulky. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-size backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great mid-size backpack. I use this walking to and from work every day, and I have found it comfortable, waterproof, and simple. It is very much like a vertical version of their classic messenger bags. There are the same pockets, and the interior lining is just like them. This has been a dream for me, as I used a Timbuk2 messenger back for 20 years. This bag has no frills. It really is the shape of a grocery sack.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great medium sized backpack for school
customer_reviews.text: Great medium sized backpack for school. Rugged, rainproof, and easy to get in and out of. I've been using this bag for over a year and it still looks new. My only complaint is that it feels too small when trying to bring a large load.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptops
customer_reviews.text: Great when you commute by bike and need to transport your computer. An additional hip belt would be appreciated when the other belt is too high for me (I am small so it slightly chokes me, so I avoid using it).
customer_reviews.author: Maryline

customer_reviews.title: Rugged look but not so waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This bag was a fine backpack, but it’s water resistance is cosmetic TPU not really sealed zippers or full waterproofing. The straps and other components will get wet and the top isn’t sealed for a real torrential downpour.
customer_reviews.author: Logan B.

customer_reviews.title: La Mochila Negra - Timbuk2
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is a bit smaller than I wanted, but I have organized my stuff and it helps me to protect them from the rain. It’s a very confortable bag and I would recommended for anyone who needs to carry a 15 inch laptop or other items. Thanks Timbuk2
customer_reviews.author: J. Juan Calderón

customer_reviews.title: Great commuter pack!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time for going back and forth from school/work and it is very comfortable and can hold a lot. It's protected all my valuables from the weather. When I wear this one out, I'll probably be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Nate C.

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Design & Material - Lightweight - U-Lock holder is a plus - Can carry a lot - Bottle opener is a plus Cons: - Back padding is slightly too thin - No zipper to fully secure the main pocket, although it has a Velcro and buckles
customer_reviews.author: B-Bry

customer_reviews.title: Superb backpack, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, to replace his old (and decaying) messenger bag. He loves it. It looks great, keeps everything neat and organized, and is comfortable to carry. His stuff is a lot more "together" since he got this pack, too--a place for everything, and everything in its place! I highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: C. OBRIEN

customer_reviews.title: Great compact bag
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for work and also use the bag for everyday use. For its size, it has ample space, a solid laptop sleeve and internal pockets and pen holders. For more organization I bought a charger/wire organizer which helps to make the most of the space. For the price, it rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Porcelli

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The back is very stiff, and the shape is awkwardly tall and narrow.
customer_reviews.author: CXW

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 is my favorite bag company. I was super excited when I found this bag because I can wear it with my uniform. It holds a lot, is water proof, and is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, plenty of room for stuff in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, plenty of room for stuff in the main compartment, as well as a nice size outer zipper pocket. Like the water resistant material a lot. The only thing preventing a 5-star review is the positioning of the shoulder straps - I wish they were positioned more on the outer part of the bag, rather than being placed more in the center. If the bag is packed full, it can put some pressure on the outside of my neck. Maybe ok for skinnier people?
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Bilbrey

customer_reviews.title: Good smaller sized water resistant backpack
customer_reviews.text: No problems with over 1 year of use. Design lets me keep electronics safe in rain. Size fits smaller laptops and a few books. Only gripe is outside pocket is very squished when main compartment is filled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Wish it was like 2 inches bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: Very spacious. I like it. Wish it was like 2 inches bigger though. :D I use it for bringing meals (tupperware) with me to work and add in my laptop it gets too tight. But seriously it's a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal
customer_reviews.text: What a deal! I commute year round, and have no complaints about this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exterior quality high, interior not as much
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it looks but the part interior are cheap for an $80 bag. cheap zippers and feel of inside, loose strings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Linden Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof/Bombproof
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Timbuk2 product and I love it. The construction is very high quality/durable. So far it’s been waterproof enough to keep my laptop/books safe on bike ride commutes in the rain. It’s a reasonable size, fairly spacious. I can fit a laptop, jacket, gloves, hat, two books, and a couple accessories in it with a bit of room to spare. The Velcro strip along the top flap is such a sick bonus! You can put Velcro on a patch and slap it on to personalise your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Skye L

customer_reviews.title: Worth while... Looks small but holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: At first the backpack looks small but it truly holds a whole mess of stuff... I've managed to put 3-days worth of underwear, and shirts, and a blanket and it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Cashi

customer_reviews.title: This bag is tough and I am in love with this Back Pack
customer_reviews.text: This bag is tough and I am in love with this Back Pack. I love it's toughness, water proof, and good looking. I feel unstoppable and I will be getting a second bag, different color! Washington, DC.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Styles Romero

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it to care my laptop around, with my preamp and headphones + microphone. I figured this would pair well with my minimal setup and its quite roomy still with all of the above items I mentioned in it. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: William Harris

customer_reviews.title: really good bag
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for 2 months now. I've walked through heavy rain, 100 degree heat, biked 8+ miles at a time, flown with it, and normal every day use. I really like it. Could benefit from 1 or 2 more zipper pockets. Overall happy with utility and quality of bag.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Slick, functional, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Really great bag for the price. I used to have a e-z scan laptop backpack, and it was unnecessarily heavy. This bag is super light, looks great, and has just the right number of pockets to put things. My only complaint is that it looks a little ridiculous if you don't fill it up. The jury is still out on the quality of the materials used - the bag itself feels a bit thin and flimsy in certain parts, but, unless you plan on using for rugged activities, you'll be fine. It's a great daily use backpack.
customer_reviews.author: SunnySanfrancisco

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and well-made backpack for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this backpack for daily use to go to work by bike, and she really loves it: - Stylish, professional looking. Which was her main concern (solid black version) - Ergonomic - Holds a 15 inch laptop well - Waterproof - Good craftsmanship so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag.
customer_reviews.text: It asked me to rate for water resistance. I gave it five stars. I’ve never used it around water.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid backpack. My daughter loves it. This is ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid backpack. My daughter loves it. This is the third Rogue in the family, mine being the oldest. The waterproofing material on mine has begun to crack, but it's 4 years old at this point and has seen alot of wear in cold and hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: Juan G.

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to use for bike commuting. I haven't heard any complaints! It seems like a HUGE improvement on his previous backpack. It's decently spacious, water tight, and comfortable on his back. The u-lock holder is also a really nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jean Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Overnight bag
customer_reviews.text: Great overnight bag that carries all my stuff no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amante

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2 to the rescue!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I use for work and have traveled with this bag twice so far. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: worst backpack in my life
customer_reviews.text: The external surface break after a year. and many other things broke. worst backpack in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: One of the best backpacks out there
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for a year now and it’s held up to rain, mud, and food. I use it for school and it’s never fallen apart. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Larry C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very function and hip
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this item. She is a teacher and carries lots of stuff to school each day. It is stylish for being so functional. Very “hip” styled backpack. Great for younger people who need to stay professional.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Best laptop backpack i have ever owned. Durable as well...daily commuter.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Brown

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Get the Spire instead. This one does have the pocket for your phone. The material looks cheap.
customer_reviews.author: David Holt

customer_reviews.title: Great lil pack
customer_reviews.text: Great for going to and from work. pretty spacious and enough small compartments to be useful. Water resistant material is a plus. Hope it doesn't crack over time. Nice and light.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. Everything was made and sewn together beautifully. Perfect for outdoor and everyday use.i use it for everything from school to fishing
customer_reviews.author: chris hoang

customer_reviews.title: Not enough pockets
customer_reviews.text: Nice build quality but there are too few pockets! Theres is only the one external front pocket, the large pocket to carry everything and a small zipper pocket within that. The opening for the bag is also too narrow, making putting things in difficult. Wearing is also very uncomfortable and cheap feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy rain
customer_reviews.text: This backpack worked fine in light rain, but the first time I used it in a heavy rain, it leaked so badly that my Nexus tablet was soaked and ruined, along with a portable charger and a book.
customer_reviews.author: BA Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome backpack, I’ve always loved Timbuk2 and their bags. I took this on my flight and I was able to fit a lot of things in there and it still was never bulky for me. The only flaw for me was the straps, really wish they were a little more comfortable for an all day carry.
customer_reviews.author: Annabel

customer_reviews.title: Headed to Timbuktu
customer_reviews.text: Awesome brand. Awesome bag. Awesome price. A bit more padding around the laptop area would be a plus, but it’s sufficient. So glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Velcro on the bag always closes well and clips have a good quality snap to them. Bag is comfortable with the front straps and good amount of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great slim pack for commuting. I've had this for a few months, and Timbuk2 quality is obvious. This bag is also great because of its low profile. Lets you navigate even in busy spaces (like the subway) without getting bumped around.
customer_reviews.author: R. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Great practical backpack - it fits everything I need for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great practical backpack - it fits everything I need for the day, it's water-resistant, and it's black (=goes with everything and doesn't look dirty). I don't use all the features, eg the bottle opener and bike lock holding straps, but they're handy to have around and might come in handy in future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the side compartment for water bottle/coffee thermos
customer_reviews.text: Carries everything and helps make the load appear lighter, I love the side compartment for water bottle/coffee thermos, it makes it easier to go handsfree. I also think its pretty stylish as a girl in engineering, its as good as its gonna get. :)
customer_reviews.author: aleearchives

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel or Work Bag
customer_reviews.text: When I travel, I like to bring one backpack. For shorter trips, if you have the right gear this bag is perfect. It has a large, single pocket and it holds 27 liters. Currently, I am using this for work. I keep my work laptop, lunch, and a couple of textbooks and study materials for a class I am taking. I have more than enough room, it looks professional enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chad T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!! It's waterproof, great for my everyday work and weekend trips!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karo

customer_reviews.title: attractive, comfy, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Really attractive and edgy. Has a laptop compartment with a velcro strap to give my 15.6 laptop a snug, secure fit. I've had this bag for more than 1 year and the shoulder straps still feel nice, sturdy, and comfortable. There is a convenient, small compartment inside (approx. 6 in. x 6 in.) which isn't shown in the pictures where I keep bandaids, ibuprofen, headphones, etc. There's also a side, elastic water bottle compartment too. Great backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Sensible Consumer

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable and fits a lot of items
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday. It is comfortable and fits a lot of items. Great for biking as well.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design with the suspended laptop holder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design with the suspended laptop holder, and I like the pockets and waterproofing. I wish I had this when I was living in Seattle.
customer_reviews.author: rbook22

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for the Seattle weather and it worked perfect during the rainiest winter we have yet experienced
customer_reviews.text: So worth it for every occasion. I bought it for the Seattle weather and it worked perfect during the rainiest winter we have yet experienced. I 100% recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Also wonderful to use when traveling or hiking
customer_reviews.text: This backpack provides all the space I need for my books and laptop for school. The bag can carry 2 large textbooks, 2 binders, some notebooks and a 15 inch laptop with ease. Also wonderful to use when traveling or hiking. The waterproof sealing was great at protecting my valuables when I went hiking near a waterfall. The only small gripe I have with this bag is the limited amount of small pockets, other than that it's a nearly perfect backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jas G.

customer_reviews.title: Looks so awesome
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer said, it should have more pockets, more padding on the straps, and a better padded laptop insert. However, it makes me feel like a cat burglar.
customer_reviews.author: whateverdotcom

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the backpack for my wife when we go on occasional bike rides. It has a more pockets than my Chrome backpack and loops for U-locks. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Quack-Quack

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the quality I expected from the description and reputation of maker, but the chest buckle is a little too high on me.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'3''. This backpack is too big and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3''. This backpack is too big and the straps dig into my neck. I had to return it. However, there's really nothing wrong with it. The material seems to be high quality and it's big enough to fit a lot of things inside.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: Timbuk2 Rogue Laptop Backpack
product_meta.description: Water resistant TPU exterior keeps rain and grime out. Internal stretch pocket fits up to a 15" MacBook Pro. Front zip pocket for small bits. Internal organizer for pens, phones, and other small stuff. 20 liter volume.
feature_bullets: THE ROGUE: A top-loading daypack for urban adventure near and far, no matter the weather
KEEP IT ORGANIZED: Front zip pocket for keeping small items in check; Large main compartment fits laptop, books, lunch, and a light jacket

CLEVER EXTRAS: On-strap bottle opener for party tricks and quick refreshment; Exterior webbing offers attachment for carabiners, or U-lock; Elasticized external side pocket for water bottle or U-lock; Internal stretch pocket compatible with up to a 15" laptop

MATERIALS & FIT: Water resistant tarpaulin exterior keeps rain and grime out; Custom-fit strap design for a truer, more comfortable fit; Ventilated back panel to give your back breathing room; Removable sternum strap

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Timbuk2 stands behind the legendary quality and craftsmanship of all our products; We also embrace the wild, twisty ways of life; If there is a defect in the materials or workmanship we will repair the bag at our discretion for the lifetime of the product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
